column1: Section 7.3.3 Summary of evidence and recommendations for the treatment of metastatic UTUC:
Recommendations

New 2023 recommendation: Offer adjuvant platinum-based chemotherapy after RNU 
to patients with pT2â€“T4 and/or pN+ disease.

New 2023 recommendation: Discuss adjuvant nivolumab with patients unfit 
for, or who declined, platinum-based adjuvant chemotherapy for > pT3 and/or 
pN+ disease after RNU alone or > ypT2 and/or ypN+ disease after neoadjuvant 
chemotherapy, followed by RNU.

2022 recommendation: Offer kidney-sparing management to patients with solitary 
kidney and/or impaired renal function, providing that it will not compromise survival. 
This decision will have to be made on a case-by-case basis in consultation with the 
patient.

Revised 2023 recommendation: Offer kidney-sparing management to high-risk 
patients with imperative indication on a case-by-case basis, in consultation with the 
patient.

Erdafitinib was associated with radiological response in platinum-refractory patients with 
locally-advanced or metastatic UC and FGFR DNA genomic alterations (FGFR2/3 mutations 
or FGFR3 fusions).

Enfortumab vedotin was associated with OS benefit in patients who had previously received 
platinum-containing chemotherapy and experienced disease progression during or after 
treatment with a PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor.
Palliative nephroureterectomy can improve quality of life by controlling symptomatic disease.
RNU can confer a survival benefit in highly selected patients.

First-line treatment in patients ineligible for cisplatin or carboplatin

New 2023 recommendation: Offer gemcitabine/carboplatin chemotherapy to

2022 recommendation: Offer checkpoint inhibitors pembrolizumab or atezolizumab 
depending on PD-L1 status.

Revised 2023 recommendation: Offer checkpoint inhibitors pembrolizumab or 
atezolizumab to patients with PD-L1 positive tumours.
Second-line treatment

New 2023 recommendation: Offer enfortumab vedotin to patients previously treated 
with platinum-containing chemotherapy and who had disease progression during or 
after treatment with a PD-1 or PD-L1 inhibitor.

2022 recommendation: Offer erdafitinib in platinum-refractory tumours with FGFR 
alterations.

Revised 2023 recommendation: Offer erdafitinib as subsequent-line therapy 
to platinum-refractory patients with FGFR DNA genomic alterations (FGFR2/3 
mutations or FGFR3 fusions).
